Nanking Nov. 8, 1937
Section 4
Dear Family:
Today was bright ad clear - not a cloud in the sky.
The Japs
bombed a passenger train north of here killing two hundred innocent non-
but they didn't bomb Nanking for which no doubt we have the
Brussels conference to thank.
and I had dinner with some old friends
Mr. and Mrs. Pan of the Ministry of Railways.
It was interesting to hear first
hand of the mervelous job the railroads are doing - they keep the trains moving
under almost impossible odds.
were dropped
In one instance over 1000 bombs of various sizes
on one short stretch of track but within twelve hours trains were
again operating over that stretch of roadbed.
and sleep in dugouts during the day time.
repair crews work at night

9th.
Beautiful day - no bomb raids.
Chinese are asking bids
on 60 basic trainer airplanes - they must think the wer will last a long time.
